column4: Hello every one I am new to ubuntu and wanted to introduce myself
could I ask for some help with qtparted?
hey david
I'm more familiar with gparted
what happens when you start qtparted?
run the command as 'sudo qtparted' to elevate your priviledges
terminal or press F2 and type it in there
gparted has a shortcut to sudo gparted listed under 'System --> Administration'
what errors?
that may be due to a device that is plugged in but not recognizable
can you format the drive?
I am trying to delete the partitions but won't allow me says it is mounted
careful, you may be looking at your system drives.  But more than likely, ubuntu automatically mounted the drive.
run 'df -h' to see what is mounted and how much space is left on the drives
you can run 'sudo umount /dev/hd<tab>' to unmount whatever drive
but you said it was sata so it would likely be /dev/sda1 or /dev/sda2
definately 'umount /dev/sda1' :)
definately 'sudo umount /dev/sda1'
after unmounting it?
you might want to close qtparted first and then umount the sda1 drive
don't worry... this stuff just takes time getting used to it
thanks a bunch at least I have a starting point
I'm learning xchat today
thanks a million
